title: Basmati
summary: Basmati (pronounced IPA: [baːsmət̪i]) is a variety of long, slender-grained aromatic rice which is traditionally grown in India, Nepal and Pakistan.[1] As of 2019, India accounted for 65% of the international trade in basmati rice, while Pakistan accounted for the remaining 35%.[2][3] Many countries use domestically grown basmati rice crops;[4] however, basmati is geographically exclusive to certain districts of India and Pakistan.[5]
